extends java.lang.Object

      Modifier and Type Method Description
      javax.ws.rs.core.Response recoverAccount​(java.lang.String username)
      The `recoverAccount` function in Java is used to recover a user's account by updating the password reset token and sending a verification email.
      javax.ws.rs.core.Response recoverUserAccount​(java.lang.String token)
      This function is used to recover a user account by checking if a given password reset token exists in the datastore and returning an appropriate response.
      javax.ws.rs.core.Response resetPassword​(java.lang.String token, java.lang.String password, java.lang.String confirmPassword)
      The above function is a Java method that handles a POST request to reset a user's password, updating the password in the database and redirecting the user to a login page.

    • Method Detail

      • recoverAccount

        @POST
@Path("/")
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response recoverAccount​(@QueryParam("username")
                                                java.lang.String username)
        The `recoverAccount` function in Java is used to recover a user's account by updating the password reset token and sending a verification email.
        Parameters:
        username - The `username` parameter is used to identify the user whose account needs to be recovered. It can be either the username or the email address associated with the user's account.
        Returns:
        The method is returning a Response object. The response can have different status codes and entities depending on the conditions in the code.

      • recoverUserAccount

        @GET
@Path("/")
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response recoverUserAccount​(@QueryParam("token")
                                                    java.lang.String token)
        This function is used to recover a user account by checking if a given password reset token exists in the datastore and returning an appropriate response.
        Parameters:
        token - The `token` parameter is a query parameter that is used to identify the user account that needs to be recovered. It is passed as a string value in the URL query string.
        Returns:
        The method is returning a Response object. If the query results have a next entity, it returns a Response with the HTML response generated by the `RecoverPwdHTMLLoader.loadHTML(token)` method. If the query results do not have a next entity, it returns a Response with an HTML error message.

      • resetPassword

        @POST
@Path("/resetPassword/")
@Consumes("application/x-www-form-urlencoded")
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response resetPassword​(@FormParam("token")
                                               java.lang.String token,
                                               @FormParam("password")
                                               java.lang.String password,
                                               @FormParam("confirmPassword")
                                               java.lang.String confirmPassword)
        The above function is a Java method that handles a POST request to reset a user's password, updating the password in the database and redirecting the user to a login page.
        Parameters:
        token - The "token" parameter is used to identify the user who is requesting a password reset. It is typically generated and sent to the user's email when they initiate the password reset process. The token serves as a temporary authentication mechanism to ensure that only the user who requested the reset can actually reset their password
        password - The "password" parameter is the new password that the user wants to set for their account.
        confirmPassword - The "confirmPassword" parameter is used to confirm the new password entered by the user. It is used to ensure that the user has entered the correct password by comparing it with the "password" parameter.
        Returns:
        The method is returning a Response object with an HTML response. The HTML response contains a message indicating that the password was reset successfully and provides a link to the login page. The response is of type MediaType.TEXT_HTML.
